Santa Cruz Wharf.name: Santa Cruz Wharf
reviews:
We were advised by the hotel staff about the best sea food restaurants around the wharf.we had the most delicious meal watching the sea lion just below us.lots of seabirds,sealions , restaurant and gift shops along the wharf. one of the longest wharf walk we had although it was both sunny and very windy
Show less
A great collection of restaurants and shops

Easy access, take card, pay when leave, not that bad, many parking spaces. Great restaurants and shops, and people watching and fisherman. Watch sunset over far cliffs and lighthouse on the water is worth the visit

We were surprised to see how cheap it was to park on the pier itself, 1$ for every 4 hours. Nice little stores to shop for souvenirs. We ate at Woodies Café, good food for not much. Take a long walk until the end of the wharf and you can the seal resting or playing. While on it you have a great view of the boardwalk. If it’s windy just bring an extra long sleeve shirt with you.
Show less

If you are fish eater the wharf gives you several options of restaurants of varying degrees of casualness. I don't eat fish so choices were extremely limited. Prices are on the high side. There a couple of souvenir shops. In a few places you may find sea lions lounging below the wharf. A nice stroll that doesn't offer much shade.
Show less
Great afternoon walk and dinner locale

Visited the wharf late afternoon and stayed til after sunset. We walked the pier the enjoyed the ocean’s salty air, watched the hearty play in the waves and checked out the shops and restaurants. Parking is cheap - $1/Hour for the first 4 hours - providing more than enough time to eat before the price “jumps” to $2/hr.
Show less
Nice walk and don't forget to look under
Enjoyed the views from the wharf and pleasant walk. The view of sunset is just awesome. The sea lions take their naps underneath just for and fyi. Many restaurants to enjoy also.

I appreciate that the wharf has free access to the sea lions that hang out toward the farthest point, but the proximity of the wharf to the boardwalk means everything on it is above average in price. Not my favorite place to go in the area-Capitola is cheaper and, in my opinion, more fun-but by no means bad.
Show less

A nice way to spend an afternoon is to visit the Santa Cruz Wharf. Plenty of parking, lots of restaurants to choose from, shops and a candy making store where you can get chocolate covered bacon or Santa Cruz salt water taffy.
You can walk or drive, at the end of the wharf is where the large sea lions congregate and watching them is interesting. You can fish from the wharf in certain areas, get food to go or just hang out and look at the magnificent Pacific.
There are fishing tours you can sign up for also from the wharf.
Parking fee is reasonable and observing marine life is free!
Show less
I love having dinner on the Santa Cruz Wharf! Lots of great restaurants to choose from. Especially fun to eat on the Wharf when it's raining and stormy. Have a great time!

Take a stroll up the wharf, and enjoy the sea lions at the top - they were all on the struts asleep when we went, which was great to see. Some nice eateries and shops. We were only there for half an hour so even had free parking!
Show less
Great views, good food and shopping!

Even though I live in Santa Cruz, I still love going out on the wharf for a meal on occassion. If you avoid peak touristy times it is an easy experience to park and find a table at a nice fish place. And on Tuesdays they validate parking, so that you don't need to pay to park. I love the ocean and Boardwalk views!
Show less

Visited in October so it slows down from the summer months, beautiful place on a nice sunny day to walk around and look at the view, lots of neat shops and restaurants around to go to. Great place to just sit on a bench and people watch. Will go back for sure.
Show less
My boys love going here. They love the rides and the beach and it's all around fun for the entire family.
Too many homeless In the past was much better In the evening was scary to walk whit the kids Out of the hotel no way to enjoy the tipical SoCal atmosphere
Like San Francisco's Pier 39 but smaller scale

...and a lot less touristy.
A line of seafood restaurants and of course the historic Stagnaro Brother's restaurant and fish market. You can drive out onto the pier almost to the end.
Sea lions are often perched atop a plank seen through a large opening in the deck of the wharf towards its end. When you hear them from the beach, you know they're way down at the end of the wharf.
Show less

Nice place to relax and bring kids.

There are shops to get local souvenirs, restaurants, candy shop, and great relaxing nature.

Listen to the sounds of the ocean, birds, sea lions, and someone’s spot a whale.

Is so comfortable out here you might just nap on the bench.
Show less

We have walked this wharf many times. It appears to be the same, but really it is ever- changing. New shops, restaurants etc. It is not the place I would like to shop unless you are looking for souvenirs from Santa Cruz. Many restaurants to choose from. We enjoyed looking at the seals which is always a good show. It is also fun to watch the fisherman cast off and hope that they get something on their line. I for one love to just watch the ocean!
Show less

Santa Wharf is located adjacent to the Santa Cruz Beach and Boardwalk, a major tourist attraction. The wharf has a variety of restaurants, gift shops, wine tasting, candy stores, and one can just stroll and peer down at the sea lions below. The Wharf has over 1 million visitors a year who come to the Santa Cruz Wharf to fish, shop, dine and sight see. Since I live in Santa Cruz, I get there a few times a year. Enjoy it every time.
Show less

Last time I strolled this wharf was three decades ago. Just did so again last month. As Jim Croce once sang, "If I could catch time in a bottle..." it would be like visiting the Santa Cruz Wharf. The shops may change. The restaurants may update. The visitors may come and go. But the place, the sea lions, and Monterey Bay seem timeless. It's a joy.
Show less

We visited Santa Cruz for a quick getaway and really enjoyed the wharf. It is not really a shopping place, but there were lots of places to sit and enjoy the water and sea life. Attached is our dinner view!
I drank a fishbowl, ate great food, admired seals and became an expert first time kayaker! We had an amazing time, kayaking was by far the best part, a must do! Don’t miss it!!!
Always a nice walk while in Santa Cruz

This is always a nice walk, you can see people fishing off the pier’s, seals below the wharf, and there’s plenty of coffee shops and candy and restaurants for everyone’s liking’s.
If you’re a geocache sure there’s one at the very end of the wharf that’s worth discovering
Show less

We got to see a local sea otter named Truffle swim around eating a crab as well as plenty of sea lions, people diving and just overall a good time, it was a quick in and out as none of the restaurants were open yet but we will certainly be ba k
Show less

Absolutely love it. Beautiful views of the beach and seaside. You can walk at any time during the day, sit to enjoy the sun and watch the sea lions. There are several restaurants and gift shops so lots of options. A must place to visit in Santa Cruz.
Show less
I walk to this place to get freah air and see the peole having a good time- it has been there over 150 years and is a mi
rgw Wharf is a mile long making it the largest wharf in the usa- a must see attraction . Just go! I usually play guitar at the end or fish thre for fun0 it is beautiful views

Absolutely love this place! You dont have to spend money since you can just sit outside, enjoy the sealions, seagulls, amazing views and sunsets. If you do get hungry or crave a cocktail, there are plenty of restaurants. Stop by for a souvenir? You can get one here too!
Show less
Very old, historic, gift shops, a few restarants. High point for us was at the very end where there were seal watching areas. Really fun.

We went for a wander down the wharf to find somewhere to eat. There was lots to choose from we went to Woodies Cafe and had a great meal with pleasant service and fantastic views of the bay. We then walked to the end of the wharf to watch the sea lions, which is a must-do they’re very entertaining!
Show less

When at the Wharf enjoy everything but then head back north on Hwy 1 and stop at Ferrell’s Doughnuts. They are the best. Definitely. I try doughnuts everywhere I travel. I’m from Montgomery Alabama and have had doughnuts all over the world. Most recently as I traveled on an Oceanic Cruise around Italy and 3 other countries. I would say this place has the top 2 Doughnut anywhere I’ve had doughnuts. Light, fluffy, full of a unique taste, and plenty of choices. And they have one of the best ol cake doughnut shaped like tractor tires topped with chocolate icing. They are just as good the day after as they are fresh. Go get you one.
Very reasonably priced. A dozen huge doughnuts. $9.95. You can’t beat that. Oh and they only accept cash.
Show less
Enjoyed the pier, was great to sit and watch the waves, get a drink. LOVED the sea lions, watched them trying to jump up into the beams and enjoyed their "barking" and antics.
A lovely place to watch people and the ocean while feeling the crisp ocean air on your face. Grab a bite to eat or a coffee and enjoy the views.
Must See Attractions (MSA) - Santa Cruz Wharf

Santa Cruz is the perfect weekend getaway for families. We planned our trip in the last minute and guess what it ended up being one of our memorable trips.
At first I thought that the Wharf at Santa Cruz to be a normal place and nothing interesting about it. To my surprise I found the Wharf a perfect place to hang out with family. Me and my family visited the Wharf multiple times. Since the wharf takes you little bit into the sea it provides a really good view of the coastline and it is kind of peace and calm. Also we were able to see some of the wildlife up close from the wharf like sea gulls and sea lions. The sea lions were sheltering under the wharf, at first we did not realize that they were present there, but when we started hearing noises from under the wharf then we spotted them. Kids will enjoy this place very much. There are places to dine here and most of them serve clam chowder which was yum yum. Overall the Wharf is a perfect place for families to relax and enjoy.
Show less

Everyone needs to walk the wharf each visit to Santa Cruz.
The shops are nice,the restaurants offer some of the freshest tastiest food in the area but watching the seal lions were nice.They play,bark and swim entertaining all who stop to watch.Quite a few memorial benches to sit and watch what's going on in the waters.
Saw a crabber catch an octopus so you never know what you might see.You'll see something different on all visits.
Fun walk on the wharf!!!!
Show less

Decent enough for some average tourist crap shopping, and the restaurants and bars looked good (we didn't eat/drink). Having cars out there kind of detracts from a nice walk out on the pier like you can do in many other cities.
For tourists looking for trinkets and candy; also food

Interesting walk that we take our visitors on, to see the seals and sea lions at the end of the wharf and to have dinner at Stagnaros. Can often see people fishing from the pier. Cars can drive out on the pier for a price, but we always walk. Lots of souvenir shops, candy shops, and restaurants. Food there is okay, but better at other locations in town.
Show less
Wharf was fun - pretty basic but the sea lions are a fabulous attraction for the kids

Enjoyed taking a walk on the pier / wharf in Santa Cruz ! Little fish markets were great and the sea lions are so fun for the kids to see ! View is beautiful as well ! Definitely will be back ! It was very cool on the wharf so make sure to dress warmly !
Show less
Shows her age and poor maintenance

Again, I used to enjoy many an afternoon stroll, lunch and shopping here on the wharf. Pier is patched so many times it isn't holding. I really feel for the shop keepers here. Several restaurants have closed. It's just sad, but the air was still the ocean smells. The harbor seals and the massive sea lions are great. Fishing still a great treat for anyone. Kayaking always has been good here.
Show less
Driving onto the old wooden wharf is a kick, with first hour parking FREE.

The old wooden wharf still hosts sight seeing boats, but it is now mainly a tourist attraction. There is an area where sea lions have taken over, and you can be very close to them, separated by a chain link fence. Animal lovers enjoy this very much. There are actually some happy hour deals at some of the restaurants, and so not all the prices are Tourist Too High.
Show less

If you want to stop at a beach and walk out on a wharf in Santa Cruz, this is the place. I'm not a "boardwalk" person (it's next to Santa Cruz Boardwalk), as I don't do rides and am not a fan of touristy stops, but I did enjoy sitting on the beach and watching my nephew play in the water. We walked out on the wharf and once again, it does have touristy shops, but I liked the water view and seeing the sea lions. They did have a small Halloween exhibit.
Show less
Nice walk. Loads of playful seals to see and photograph from the pier. Shops and restaurants to visit. Good for all ages. Handicapped parking on the pier.
Our first time driving on a wharf!

We were fascinated with the seal and sea otters that were under the wharf and spent a long while watching them and trying to figure out how the seal got up onto the high beams! Then we walked down and found a place to eat.
Lots to do plenty on cheap parking close to beach boardwalk and many hotels. Down town with in walking district

Several places from coffee shops to full restaurants and bars. Decent Mexican food and basic meal options at Splash. Shops are mainly tourists nik nack type stuff. Fun to roam and watch the sea lions bark and play off warf.

Whenever I am in the area I enjoy a walk to the end of the wharf. There are always barking sea lions under the pier, people fishing, take away sea food, restaurants, gift shops, hand holding, children laughing. Plus a great view back at Santa Cruz. I sat with several people to watch the sunset
Show less
Had lunch at the Harbor Cafe
so I got a chance to walk down by the water and look at all the boats, away from the Boardwalk crowd

Such a beautiful, character-filled old Wharf lined with great shops, restaurants and takeaways - the Dolphin Restaurant does great fish and chips - we got them from the to go window and sat out enjoying the sunset. Wherever you are on the Wharf you can hear the sea lions barking away at each other and can stand and watch them rolling around for ages as they are all so entertaining and seemingly oblivious to the people high up above them watching their interaction.
Show less

The iconic Santa Cruz Wharf is home to several excellent restaurants. During the summer, the quality of service drops a bit, but in the off-season, you can get great food and service at excellent prices.
The weather has been perfect this trip & we always enjoy a stroll along the pier. Rivas restaurant is our favorite for seafood!

Had a nice little stroll along the pier whilst on holiday with great views of both coastline & my gorgeous wife. Wandering holding hands in the sun, what could be better. Saw lots of Sea Lions that live under the pier. Worth a visit if in the area. 9/10
Show less

If you're on the beach boardwalk, the wharf is close enough to walk to but not worth a special trip. First impression, dingy and in disrepair. Restaurants uninspiring except perhaps a new place called Splash and outdoor seating at The Dolphin at the end of the pier. Decided not to try either because the wharf overall felt actually more depressing than inviting.
Show less

What a beautiful stretch of coastline. We saw pelicans, otters, sea lions by the boardwalk. There were beautiful stretches of beach, light house, surfing memorials etc. lots of fun to walk and take in the scenery.

Several good restaurants, a made-in-Santa Cruz shop, Mariani's candy shop and a chance to watch to harbor seals. Gilda's is an old established restaurant for a variety of everyday entrees and sandwiches. Has nice views and good prices.
Nice place to stroll plenty of restaurants and shops
We went for a stroll and dinner. Nice view. Plenty of restaurants to choose from. Nice shops. Good place to wander around.
Restaurants seemed a bit run down and dirty outside of entrances. At at one, was ok, but not very clean, tables, etc.

The Santa Cruz wharf embodies the glory of the Bay Area surf, sun, sand, seagulls, sea lions, souvenirs and delicious seafood!!!!

We enjoyed a sunny day at the wharf for lunch at the FireFish Grill restaurant. We enjoyed outstanding fresh seafood and one heck of a bacon cheese burger.

The wharf was a delightful mixture of old and new, classic and modern, and had us wishing we had more time to enjoy all the shops and restaurants.

If only the ocean wasn't so calm, I'm sure we would have seen quite a surfing show as well.
Show less
The wharf is a great place to shop, eat, kayak, seal watch, stroll with your honey or just get away from the crowds. Very relaxing!!! Just needs to be cleaned up a little bit.

We visited the wharf on a recent combined business/pleasure trip to Santa Cruz. My husband loves fishing of all types, so we loaded up our rods and mini-tackle box and headed out. The whole area was a little confusing for strangers to the area ( like us) and we ended up heading around the block a couple of times before we got our bearings. You have to pay to park on the wharf, so if you enjoy walking it is probably smarter to find an all day lot close by and take a hike! We had heard that fishing was usually only fair and that was our experience as well. There are a variety of shops and restaurants
all along the walk which we enjoyed. We picked up several souvenirs including a terrific fleece jacket at less than half price! It's my new favorite fall jacket. Lunch was at Woody's (separate review), and we wondered past a number of other restaurants as well.

Photo opportunities are plentiful, so don't hesitate to bring your camera.
Show less
lots of restaurants to choice from on the wharf and there is parking there too. Boardwalk was closed. There are a lack of nice hotels.
Sea lions or seals were fun to watch and the seafood was great.

Be sure to visit the Wharf. It is paid parking - pay when you leave - but there seemed to be parking all along the wharf. Best to go to the far end, park and watch the seals and sea lions on the wharf structure below though big square fenced openings in the pier. You may see them better in the sun on a section that sticks out on the south side of the pier a bit back toward shore so walk down that side.
While the seals are fun to watch (and listen to while they "bark") the other main feature of the Wharf is the seafood. Stagnola Brothers has been there since 1937 run by the same family offering fine dining inside for fairly moderate prices or outside you can get carry out at lower prices including soups like chowder, seafood , and sandwiches. Outside they also sell, like a market, fresh fish both local catch and other seafood to take home and cook yourself. This place is as authentic as you can get and the local fish as fresh as you can get so you can imagine what they serve inside is excellent too. It was. But there are a number of other good restaurants on the pier (like Riva Cafe) so if you are there for a few days or nights you have a number of good choices.
Show less

I enjoyed strolling the Wharf. Shops and restaurants and plenty to see. Walk to the end of the wharf to view the sea lions. They sleep and play under the wharf and can be viewed on the sides and through the viewing area.
Nice views and lots of Sea Lions

The wharf has a good range of shops and restaurants. It also has great views of the boardwalk and the beach. If walk to end on the left hand side you can't help but hear the constant barking of the Sea Lions catching the sun and playing around.
Show less
Longest wharf in the USA Half mile Long
This was really fun. For 5 bucks you can drive out on the wharf. There are several place to eat and drink. Great time
Sea Lions Are Always Fun; Dinner at The Dolphin - Santa Cruz Wharf

We have visited Santa Cruz Wharf many times. This time we went around sunset. We liked seeing the sea lions. There were lot of them. We then enjoyed dinner at The Dolphin. There is a parking fee to visit the Wharf.
No different to other wharfs along this part of the coast

Having visited Pier 39 in San Francisco and Monterey Wharf there isn't a huge difference. Shops and restaurants abound with great views out into the bay, the ever present sea lions and sea birds. Saying that you still feel like you have to take the stroll and tick it off the list of things to do while in Santa Cruz
Show less
A must sea while in Santa cruz

Old time wharf, lots of sea lions sitting under shards, cut out for viewing. Good view of amusement park on beach. Expensive parking, meters are best if you can get one (1.50/hour) . Kitchy, old time vibe. Breezy walk and nice views of ocean front.

Spent a half day road trip from San Fran to Santa Cruz by driving Route 1, which was a great scenic drive in itself. Rather clean for a wharf. easy parking but it was a week day. Had nice lunch here at Dolphin restaurant, and took lots of photos. great views. nice breeze that day. surrounding area was a nice walk.
Show less

We would never come to Santa Cruz and not stop in at the Wharf. Loads of shops and restaurants, but the viewing of the seals and sea lions is amazing. Could gaze at them for hours! You can also rent kayaks, and there is lots of people watching to be done!
Show less

The only place I will eat on the wharf. I try to make the 35 mile trip once a month just to order the luncheon crab salad which has no shortage of crab and even the bread that is from a local bakery is delicious. I have been going for several years and the quality does not change
Show less
Never knew you could drive on boardwalk

Parking - they don't validate - $10 a trip. Love the wharf in general - a night out with dinner, drinks, and walk down the pier was great. There are places to watch and listen to seals here (opposite of restaurants) so great place to show the kids.

Dinner - if you're going to wait - get a spot by the window. I mean... you are there for the experience.
Show less

Parking is crazy here. We had to go around the block a few times to find a car park, and they charged us $20. There is still lots to see and do if you don't want to spend money on rides and it does not cost anything to go into the area.
Show less

The pier is dead during the morning and weekdays (which is when I visited). I used to visit 50+ years ago and it has changed little over the years although it should! It is tired and in need of sprucing up. The area around it is rather run down and in need of urban renewal.
Show less
Great place to view the sea lions!

My goal, when in Santa Cruz, is to be doing something along the water, enjoying the views of the ocean, the sea life, dining with a view of the sea,..... One of the best options if you want to observe some sea life is to go to the Santa Cruz Wharf. There are many sea lions resting on the piers under the wharf, with several viewing spots, with rails, towards the far end of the pier. There are often people fishing along the pier, and so you'll also see sea gulls ready to take their catch, as well as pelicans flying by. Many times you will also see some otters or seals swimming in the ocean, as well. It's a great place to capture some photos, and you have a view of the Beach Boardwalk, as well. Then there are the dining establishments and tourist shops. If you wanted a Santa Cruz sweatshirt, beach-related souvenirs, etc., there are a few little shops to browse through, and quite a few restaurants, as well as walk-up food stand options where you can enjoy a meal, while observing the activities going on around the wharf and the sea. Or, just rest on a bench to relax and unwind, looking out towards the ocean.

I didn't give it 5 stars, as it's not the best restaurants, nor are there a lot of shops, but it is an enjoyable escape, and worth wandering along, if you are in the area. Parking on the wharf is currently $7.
Show less

Not so good. They tried
To make everything alright, but the food was just not great. Don't try to feed an Englishman bad fish and chips. Fish was dry and Panko. Real fish and chips are batter fried. The ceviche was ok. Views were good, but a tourist trap.
Show less
My kids and I enjoyed walking here more than the boardwalk. They enjoyed seeing the seals and otters. It is great fun to people watch here, too. There are a couple of restaurants and restrooms.
The wharf is loaded with shops and restaurants. Seals live under the pier and fun to watch them sleeping. Sound of all their barking is very loud.
A nice walk and places to satisfy your appetitr

The wharf or pier is lengthy and a good home to the end. Along the way I bought a jacket as I was cold. I realized my last hoody was from Santa Cruz when I visited in 2010. If you prefer other souvenirs there is an assortment, along with chocolate and candy, food and coffee. At the end of the pier I enjoyed a bowl of chowder while listening to the sea lions and when I got back to the start a cup of coffee. The next night we ate dinner outside on the pier. Both days, there salespeople strolling, fishing, eating and drinking. A popular splendor visitors.
Show less

if you are craving seafood this is a great place to stop by. May different kind of restaurants await you to try from cheap fry fish to expensive dine in you can choose. You can also rent boats and shop the shops so plan ahead.
Restaurants, shops, sea lions with a great view

Great way to spend a few hours. Lots of quirky shops to browse in and the sea lions are always a hit. They have some really good food on the wharf hitting all the price points. The various restaurants have amazing views and haven't disappointed yet even after 40 years of visits.
Show less

The seals halfway out are very entertaining, and you can get pretty close to them (from the perch above). The view of the bay is great. But the stores are touristy and parking is expensive and hard to get close.
Nice walk, the seals are amazing!

We came to have lunch but even better than the food was seeing the beautiful seals and sea lions! They're simply adorable! Nice view of the boardwalk. Stagnaro was a bit overrated and it would have been nice if they allowed restaurants to validate parking.

As stated in other reviews it's a wharf. There are souvenir shops and restaurants starting about half way down. We didn't stop at any of them but watched the fishermen, people in kayaks, surfers and of course the sea lions. There are a set of stairs you can go down to get an up close look and see their antics under the wharf also. This is well worth the walk out onto the wharf.
Show less

I was surprised by the empty stores on the Santa Cruz wharf and thought it seemed a little rundown. It was clear that some restaurants and shops had closed, while the remaining stores were pretty touristy. We enjoyed watching lifeguards dive off the side of the wharf and saw many sea lions barking and lounging on a deck just underneath.
Show less
Lovely afternoon walk and visit to see the barking sea lions.

I wanted to take my son here to see barking sea lions. He loved hearing them from a distance and then getting to peak through the cut outs in the wharf to spy on them. We were able to see quite a few of them laying around and just snoozing. He had a blast counting them and watching the funny ways they were lying in. They are some shops and eateries to extend your visit as well. We loved the breezes and being able to enjoy the ocean without competing with all the bodies on the beaches.
Show less
My son had a great time catching anchovies, and everyone enjoyed the antics of the sea lions. Lots of nice shops and restaurants too.

What more is there to say? A lot. One the left hand side, about the middle, there is a place were the sea lions hang out and it is fun to watch them roll into the water. Sometimes you can even go down and get fairly close if the stairs are open. Great food all along the way, snack shop, and trinket shops, too. The place just smells great, like a wharf should/
Show less

There are some retail shops and restaurants (we didn't eat there), other than that it's just regular pier like all the others. A good place to hang out with your lover and romancing the ocean horizon, seagulls and pool of fish down below.

A memorable place to visit and experience the California coast and its culture. People are laid back and friendly, good restaurants, and memorable viewing of sea lions and other wildlife.
One caution: I initially parked away from the wharf area along River street. I noticed some vagrants (hobos) trying to break into a parked car. Parking in bigger lots near the wharf would seem safer as there are gate attendants.
Show less

Amazing to go out on the fishing pier and hear the sea lions bark and see the little sea otters trying too open the oysters And all suddenly a huge whale is throwing itself out of the water only a hundred meter from the pier Wow
Show less
All of Santa Cruz is worth seeing

This is a lovely beach town . The wharf is nice . There are hotels as you walk away from the wharf that are nice to eat and watch the scenery.

On the wharf itself we had tried several restaurants and it was not good at all :Not the seafood or anything else we tried there.

If you drive away from the wharf towards the right as you face the sea there is an area where you can park your car and have a lovely walk and view of the sea.

There is an amusement area but we did not visit it to the left of the wharf.
Show less
Seems to be a great culture here. Volleyball courts line the wharf and this attraction is closely accompanied by the famous Santa Cruz Boardwalk

The wharf is very nice and has some fantastic views. You can see a lighthouse where the surfers Museum is and at night the boardwalk looks fantastic all lit up. There are a lot of restaurants and the one we ate at was pretty good, the highlight of the whole window view into Monterey Bay. You could hear and see sea lions barking under the wharf.
Show less
great place to see the sea lions
The wharf was the highlight of our trip due to the sea lions. They were so close. We watched them for a while. I loved watching them sleep, bark, and interact with each other.

You can't go wrong with the amazing views of the ocean and surrounding coast. There are fun little trinket shops along the wharf and several restaurants. I would have liked to see more interesting boutiques because all of the stores basically carry the same "Santa Cruz" apparel and touristy items. None of the restaurants really popped out as exceptional, and the one we ate at was pretty 'average'. But, all in all, the walk down to the end was worth it because there is nothing like being on the water.
Show less

We spent a few hours here for the kids to ride some rides. We enjoyed watching the sea lions, playing some sand volleyball, eating dinner, and of course the rides. We happened to go on a Monday night, which was retro night. All the rides were only 1.50 each, so that was a nice surprise. Although it was a bit crowded becuase of this, but not too bad. Kids and teens really enjoyed it!
Show less

We came here as a kid, now we live here. The wharf has a lot if Great restaurants, shops and even a candy shop. You can parkl and go to the Boardwalk if you'd like, but if you're going to be there all day, don't park here. You are able to fish off the pier and I'm not sure if this is replace they have fishing charters. A great place to visit.

We visited on a cooler day, the wharf was not crowded and parking spots were plentiful. However, if you arrive before 10, not all the shops are open and most of the restaurants aren't either. Easy to navigate if you are there to see the view and watch the sea lions and seals.
Show less

Parking is available on wharf, plenty of restaurants and some shops. Below wharf there is spot where sea lions congregate. You can walk down steps for up close and personal view and photos. View is gorgeous

Santa Cruz is so nice and the Boardwalk is so famous but you never really hear of the wharf. They have one but it isn’t in tip top condition. There is such potential here. Other way smaller cities have nice wharfs and Santa Cruz’s is pretty much for show. You can go and shop but I’m telling you it’s just not nice. Might as well and wait till you get to Frisco.

Nice restaurants claiming to have fresh seafood!

Much slower pace wharf than San Francisco. People are strolling leisurely, enjoying views of the boardwalk and locals fishing for small fishes. Many places to eat and clothing shops. Fun to see fisherman. Long walk to end of wharf. Pretty view of Boardwalk and beach.

I love the wharf it's a great place to get some beautiful views and along with the beautiful restaurants you can always get something good to eat in one of the fine restaurants. First time here n I heard the cry of a sea lion for the first time !! It was a nice walk n there is always a cold wind even in summers!! This place is super duper crowded which is the only drawback !! It's beautiful around wen u look from here !!

The local council needs a shake up.
Such a potential gem, looks like a run down business. Tourist tshirt shops, average food outlets, wharf urgently needs millions spent to fix the decay.

While in town for a couple of days, we took a couple of walks down the wharf, once midday and once Friday Evening. The wharf has a number of restaurants, gift shops, and awesome views of the ocean and Beach Boardwalk.

If you have some extra time while visiting the area, I recommend driving or walking down the wharf. Oh and you can enjoy some good ice cream or candy there too.

Enjoy!

We walked up here a couple of times, a few shops & restaurants to look at and eat in. It's a great spot to look at the views. We mostly stood looking at seals!
Excellent stop and lots to see & do. Lots of marine life to see. Seafood in abundance. Close to the Boardwalk and also free to walk down. Walk right to the end for great pics of the sea lions etc

A very nice pier/wharf if your in Santa Cruz and definitely worth a slow stroll to take on the view of Santa Cruz in the distance, the seals, restaurants etc. It want blow your head but it's a very nice hour spent and in a good location to explore other things.

A Great Place for an Outing!

We, a family group of five including our grand daughter, had gone on a weekend visit to the Santa Cruz Wharf and Pier. Being a weekend, it was a bit of a challenge to get a parking spot. The boardwalk has several attractions including several rides. The Pier is unique in that there is parking available on the pier itself. There are several restaurants and a variety of shops. There is also a bonus opportunity of fishing from the pier.
Show less
A stroll on the pier is a must

Be sure to bring your fishing pole and a "Lucky Joe" jig and fish for rock cod, perch, smelt, etc. No license required! The pier has fresh-caught fish for sale and an assortment of restaurants to fit every budget and taste. Or charter a fishing boat. Great views of the Boardwalk, the beach, and the surrounding cliffs.

The wharf doesn't only offer a fine choice of restaurants and tourist shops / boutiques, but also a great view of the beach and boardwalk; a great place for sunsets.
Santa Cruz itself left us scratching our foreheads, we've never been there before, we will never come back again. Hopefully our experience, will save my friends time and money.

This very very long pier is a great place to stretch your legs and get some fresh sea air in your lungs while enjoying a great view, day or night. There are shops and restaurants, but they are easy to ignore if you like. The view back to the boardwalk is great, and better still are the sea lions that cluster under the pier in easy view, and the pelicans along the railings! This is an unforgettable part of any vacation to Santa Cruz.

Great for a Stroll and more!

Gift shops, restaurants, ice cream shops line your walk towards the end of the wharf. Stop and watch the sea lions sleep or play. The views from any side are fabulous but don't feed the seagulls ... they will hover above and drop dangerous processed food on you. True fact!

Nice drive-on pier with shops and restaurants

You have to pay to park on the wharf, but it was worth it for us, because it is a long walk to the end. Make sure and check out the amazing water fountain towards the end of the pier in front of one of the restaurants- cool octopus metal sculpture.

the Wharf is a great place to spend the afternoon soaking up some of the local flavor of Santa Cruz. Lots of neat shops & eateries.

Nice wharf to walk down. Price for our parking in the wharf parking lot was $5 for about 1 and 1/2 hour to 2 hours. If you are already at the Beach Boardwalk for the day and have paid your $15 parking pass for the day, you can easily walk here. Has lots of restaurants and shops with some reasonably priced items in them. We went in the morning and the seals you can watch off the side of the wharf were jumping out of the water and doing flips on their own in their own habitat, better than Sea World.

Pleasantly surprised by the good dining options. Fire Fish Grill. Super and casual. A bit upscale from some of the other place. Decent shopping for beach related items as well.
This place has some nice gifts at reasonable prices. There are several places that offer nick nacks to t-shirts. There are also several food places to eat so you can rest and enjoy some good food.
Drove from sac when the temps got to over 100. Good food and a nice walk with cool ocean air. You can rent a boat or fish from the pier.

I never fail to stop at the Wharf when I'm in Santa Cruz. I love viewing the sea lions. Even when they are not perched on the boards under the Wharf, you can see starfish and/or other good things!
The shop "Made in Santa Cruz" is a really fun stop and there are several good restaurants! I would recommend Gilda's for anytime; try to get a window seat! Dolphin at the end of the Wharf is also good for casual occasions and has a wonderful view. For a little more formal milieu, Stagnaro Bros. is the bomb!
The Santa Cruz Boardwalk can be seen from the Wharf and there are photo ops and take-out seafood and typically beautiful weather.
The Santa Cruz Wharf is one of my personal "Happy Places".

Stunning views back to the carnival ashore and out to see. Heaps of shops and places to eat. But when you hear that sea-lion holler its just magic...wow
Lots of things to do and places to eat
Very busy wharf with lots of places to eat.... a nice place to have a stroll. Parking is a challenge.

Hit up the wharf on a Thursday evening and it was not too busy which made it enjoyable. We walked the length to check out all the shops and restaurants before deciding where to eat. The sea lions were not around so it was quiet, but didn't get to check them out. Beautiful view of the water and shoreline and the sunset was also very peaceful.

Each restaurant is a bit overpriced, but it's worth it to hit a happy hour or two. The views in most places are great and you can watch people swimming and kayaking; we even saw two seagulls trying to steal a fish from a sea lion.

Great spot to eat, walk and shop Easy access and just the right amount of shops, not overwhelming. Food is very good especially clam chowder!
Shop, Eat and View Sea Lions on This Huge Wharf

This huge long wharf (2,745 feet) is the longest pier on the West Coast of America. It was built in 1914 for commercial purposes. Now it's for tourists to shop for a variety of souvenirs including a local sock shop and to enjoy a meal at the many mainly seafood restaurants. Another pastime is to watch the sea lions, with the bull, his cows and the pups, rest and sun themselves and eventually clumsily move on the raft to slip into the water. The innumerable wood pilings support the paid parking spots on the pier besides the tourists. We visited the wharf twice in the two days we spent in Santa Cruz and enjoyed this top tourist spot.
Show less

As expected there are a number of tourist shops on the wharf and restaurants. We had fun watching the sea lions cavort and enjoyed walking along the wharf to the end. Had lunch and walked back. As mentioned, there is a parking fee on the wharf and metered on the streets around it. But it was not too bad--$1 for 20 minutes so $3 for an hour. It was a nice way to view the city and the amusement park next door.
Show less
Nice quick walk with shops and cafes along the way. Good place to see surfers and when I was there they had lifeguard training that was fun to watch
A pleasant walk with great views out to sea, the Boardwalk and the beach. Seals are a regular attraction. Some great places to eat - either sit-down or just seafood at one of the kiosk vendors.

Star performers were the seals, nude sunbathing mid-way up the pier.

Funny how watching them doing nothing at all was so fascinating. It was like a zoo out there, standing only 10 feet away from those lazy animals!

Don’t know about allowing cars to drive up & down the short distance. The asphalt looked pretty run down, with cracks all over the place…

Great views of the Bay, Boardwalk, surfing, sea life. If you don't go to the wharf you've missed out on local shopping...check out the stores that have items from local artists! Watch and listen to the sea lions resting underneath. It can be breezy even on a hot day so you might want a sweater. I love the seafood and clam chowder from most of the restaurants, but love the view from Stagnaro's upper level.

It's nice - touristy. Compare to Monterey, Santa Monica,... it's nice when you're there. Splash is a fun restaurant with a rotating platform, some shops - so if you're there, it's good for a stroll or run but not a destination.
Nice walk on a warm day.
Lots of parking for a price. Lots of restaurants and gift shops. The best part however is the views of the ocean, beaches, and boardwalk. A good way to enjoy a warm day and a nice walk.
Great place for a morning run

We went to SC for weekend and I ran the wharf every morning- beautiful run! My teenagers came with me one morning and stopped for clam chowder which they are for breakfast! Very friendly people and a scenic view!
very scenic walk, some stores and places to eat. Nice view of the beach

We recently returned from Santa Cruz and had a nice time there. The wharf is basically the main strip alongside the beach in Santa Cruz. It is very scenic, great for people watching (sand volleyball games going on, etc.) and has some nice shops and eateries along the way. We had lunch at a nice little place called the Picnic basket which has a nice view of beach. Great area for biking as well.

The wharf is very nice to take a romantic stroll on with quaint little shops and restaurants to grab a bite or a drink if you prefer. We came on a gray, cool morning, and the wharf was pretty quiet. We enjoyed the views and the barking sea lions. We didn't really go into the (touristy) shops. There is parking on the wharf, but we did street parking about a block away.

We arrived early morning and we drove inside without having to pay because they charge for parking from 10 AM. We had a nice walk, took photos of the seals and had coffee in one of the restaurants with nice ocean view.

Santa Cruz is a fun place to visit. There are cute coffee shops, boardwalk rides, birds, fisherfolk and the like. It is fun to walk along the waterfront and hear the waves and see the sight. Beware tar in the sand though!

Worth all the hassles of parking (we walked a mile) to get to the end and see the sea lions below! Bring your own sunscreen - we couldn't find a single shop, out of all those tourist traps, that sold it!

Enjoyed walking down the Wharf, watching surfers/sea lions, checking out the shops and stopping for dinner. Within walking distance of the beach boardwalk.

I've been going here for years. There are shops, restaurants and great views. You can also watch the sea lions
Eat, fish, listen to music, shop, talk to the seals, watch the boats,walk, etc.
Great place for many activities or just to hang out at. There is something for everyone who loves the Ocean. Parking is a problem if you don't get here early on weekends.

The wharf is a main attraction for Santa Cruz visitors. Situated adjacent to the boardwalk, it is a nice vantage point to see the boardwalk and to observe the sea lions that inhabit the substructure of the wharf. There are a variety of businesses on the wharf that range from rentals of kayaks to great seafood restaurants. The Dolphin Restaurant is a tiny place towards the end of the pier that serves great clam chowder in a bread bowl although several other places do the same. You will have to explore for yourself. Parking is not free.

Nice long pier for walking or fishing. Plenty of bathrooms. Places to eat and get a drink. Can rent boat. Souvineers. Parking available on the pier. Can be cool so jacket may be good to bring.

Excellent Spot To View the Water with Nice Shops and Restaurants

I was impressed with this wharf and the views it offers of the water around Santa Cruz. You have the option of parking and walking out on the pier or you can drive out and park on the pier itself. There are many local shops and restaurants

There is a secret little bar in one of the restaurants that overlooks the water. I'm not saying which one, you will have to explore a bit. Twice a year you can bring a chair and watch the fireworks. sweater.

Take a stroll down the infamous Santa Cruz wharf - full of beach shops and restaurants. For home cooked style cooking, dip into Gilda's restaurant - they have just about everything on their menu! For breakfast, try their crab omelet and be sure to get their homemade salsa! For dinner - prim rib special and their cioppinno are both a locals favorite

So, I never really thought much of stopping to see the wharf until I read some reviews on here. If you are in or near Santa Cruz, this is a MUST DO! We paid a few bucks for parking ($3 I think), we walked around and shopped. The shops were quaint and not too touristy. However, the highlight of the trip were the Sea Lions! They were awesome! At the end of the wharf they made several cut outs so you can view the resting sea lions. I could have stayed there all day watching the resting ones, as well as the ones swimming around. You can hear them barking as soon as you get out of your car! They are so amazing and you can get so close!

Lots of nice restaurants, a couple of tourist shops, great views of the water and surfers. Right next to the boardwalk but less congested. Definitely recommend a stroll on the wharf.
We had dinner on the Wharf then enjoyed listening to and watching the California sea lions (or was it seals, i forgot). Very nice evening. Parking is available on the wharf.

Visited here with friends and we strolled all the way to the end of the wharf and even managed you have lunch there. Very relaxing and different if you are not used to the ocean. There is a large presence of Sea Lions under the pier and they can be very entertaining. I highly recommend visiting should you be in the area.

Great for walking and sight seeing
Bring lots of money for the rides and games. No public parking either so be prepared to pay for parking.

This is pleasant wharf, which shops, restaurants, and even a wine tasting room. The sea lions are fun to watch; there are plenty of them out toward the end of the wharf. We ate dinner at one of the restaurants, we were seated at a window table with a gorgeous view of the ocean. Very enjoyable way to spend a late afternoon, early evening.

I live in Santa Cruz and never tire of seeing the California sea lions that hang out underneath the pylons at the end of the wharf. Whether you're dining out or shopping on the wharf, make sure to also check out these amazing animals.
fun stop and don't miss the end of pier seal display
This was a nice relaxing stroll before lunch. Views are just spectacular. lots of seals at end of pier. eat lunch at one of the restaurants.

The pier has a few touristy shops and several restaurants. In fact mostly restaurants. Looks run down at spots and a couple of businesses closed down. Reminded my wife and I of an area that is going down in upkeep and businesses. We were there on a Saturday_ cloudy but no rain and people traffic was very light. Compared to other areas like Santa Barbara and Santa Monica piers this is not even close.

A little too crowded for my taste

This is a go-to tourist destination but on a real tourist weekend you'll have a lot of competition for the paved sidewalk. There are other less popular places that have as good or better views--try Point Lobos State Park but again watch for crowds!
The Santa Cruz Wharf is a delightful place for locals and tourists alike.

There are frequently tourists that enjoy basking in the sun, souvenir shops, the early morning fishing boats, kayaking, the myriad of restaurants, and of course the seal watching at the end of the Wharf. The locals usually enjoy the simpler pleasures, tourist watching, enjoying the sun and eating at the many delightful restaurants replete with clam chowder, and the fresh seafood meals. However be warned, you will need a few dollars to get off the Wharf as the rules have changed, a fee will be required when you drive past the toll shacks. FYI, it is still free for pedestrians to enjoy the Wharf at no charge.

Little tourist shops and plenty of seafood restaurants from quick to expensive. Some empty storefronts and worn out buildings. Even a Marini's location on the wharf to get your sugar fix. Parking can be difficult and honestly walking the entire wharf is nice and easy. Nights get chilly so being a sweater or coat.

You can park on the wharf or walk from the parking lot at the bottom of the wharf..a long walk. Most of the stores are selling ocean related trinkets and shirts. However there are a few good restaurants located here. The advantage of eating here is the view of the Pacific if you choose well.

Great spot to take friends, family, kids
Cute shops, restaraunts, indoor and outdoor seating at some restaraunts with beautiful ocean views. Can see seals lounging below wharf on beams of wharf, easy to see boats, surfers, marine wildlife.
Great place to see seals and sea lions. Grab a coffee and wander to the end. Views are fantastic at night (seeing the Boardwalk's lights undulate in the water).
Beautiful scenic views all around. You can walk or drive on. We drove half way and then walked through the shops. Had dinner while the sun set
a place to show someone from out of town

the wharf is very close the boardwalk so you can visit both places fairly easily. If the weather is nice, the walk is very pleasant. Parking can be tough but today was not bad because it is still winter.

this is a great boardwalk for restaurants and seeing otters and sea lions. it is not too long and the view of the lighthouse is delightful

We decided to meander down the wharf on our recent visit to Santa Cruz. It was a beautiful day. The sea lions were sun bathing on the pylons of the pier. The sun was shimmering on the ocean. The views were beautiful and all the little shops and eateries were delightful. It was not crowded and it was very relaxing. We had a Bloody Mary at one of the little diners with an outstanding view. If you are in the mood for a stroll and would like to take in some great views, the wharf if the place.

Wharf is very old. Needs work. That being said, it's a nice place to sit on a sunny day. Go out to the end. Grab a coffee or something sweet from Marini's. Enjoy the view and the sea lions.

It was a sunny afternoon that I wandered down to the boardwalk and discovered the wharf. As I was walking out the wharf it seemed to go on and on and on. I had no idea what was at the end of The Wharf and I was pleasantly surprised just see all the sea lions swimming in the water and lounging on the rafters. I didn't stop at any of the restaurants, and there were plenty. I would definitely recommend walking The Wharf when you come just Santa Cruz
Show less
A Must See If You Are in Santa Cruz

If you want to really "get" Santa Cruz and experience the biggest bang for your time and buck, the Wharf is the place to do it. This is not like any Wharf you've been to. First off, you can drive right onto the Wharf and there's plenty of parking. You pay a very reasonable parking fee on the way out so no worries about overstaying a parking meter and getting a ticket.
There are lots of restaurants featuring local catch, souvenir stores, fishing expeditions, and fishing. As you stroll the Wharf, you will likely hear the melodic howls of the sea lions that love to hang out on the structural members under the Wharf. There are lots of places from which you can watch them lazing around or climbing over each other.
On one side of the Wharf is the World famous surfing area, Steamer Lane, On the other side is the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk, the oldest amusement park West of the Mississippi. I believe it was voted the best beachside amusement park in America at least once. It is very well managed. The Boardwalk’s original Ruth & Sohn band organ has played alongside the Looff Carousel since 1911. In addition to the original Ruth organ, a rare Wurlitzer 165 band organ from the former Playland-at-the Beach amusement park in San Francisco now shares playing time with the Ruth. There is also indoor miniature golf and a large game arcade, all in an iconic building right on the beach.
If you can, sit down to dinner at one of the restaurants just before sunset. You'll be at eye level with dozens of birds cruising by the windows and the sunsets are beautiful.
If that's not enough for one spot, Santa Cruz just added the Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary Exploration Center.
Lastly, Roaring Camp Railroad, another must do in Santa Cruz, has a tourist train that runs from their replica Old West Village in Felton down to the Boardwalk. In fact, you can take an early train down from Felton and spend the day at the Beach and Wharf, then take a later train back up to Felton. An unbeatable day!
So don't miss this spot or you'll have missed some of the best Santa Cruz has to offer.
Show less

Walking along the front is great, even at dusk, you could see the sea lions coming up onto the pier to sleep for the night. Quite a few places to eat, parking on the pier is reasonable.
I did not realise this was the location for lost boys until I got home!!
I am likely to visit here agai during summer, to get the most out of this sea side city.

Years full of Memories cruzing down the wharf strip in Santa Cruz. Easy access to the beach, board walk, shops, resturants, hotels, and the location where the movie "The Lost Boys" was filmed.

Even though they are remodeling part of the boardwalk, the place is always a blast! The arcade is crazy, the rides are fun, the food super greasy, and they still have the rings on the carousel that you can throw in the clown's mouth. Love this place!!

It's one of those places you have to visit at least once if you're in the area. I was happy with the eatery we chose spontaneously for a late lunch. The shops are good, but somewhat repetitive. Fantastic views and photo opportunities.
Really spectacular views, even at night. One idea is to catch the sunset here, which is what we did. Really fun energy here.

Great place for a mid-long walk. If you think 25*C temperature is good for a beach day (which is perfect in europe even in Oct) - you are wrong. There's nearly no one around. Whish to be there again when the season is in its glory!
As a reward you can always speak to the Sea Lions!

Nice walk to say Hello to the seals

Love the wharf. There is food there and water activities and the best part are the seals lazing around and humping at the end of it. Highly recommend. I had been there 24 years ago too and still remember it. Not much has changed.

Such a lovely place to take a leisurely stroll, enjoy the calls of the local sea lions that like to hang out here, watch the sun set over the land, gaze at the beautiful boats, people watch and meandering in and out of kitschy local shops and tasting the delights of the restaurants. It really is simply a lovely place. Free to visit and a place to enjoy. I enclose a picture of the view walking along here as the sun went down.

This is a nice walk. It is free when you walk on the warf.. There are always sea lions sleeping under wharf near the end where the holes are. Good picture taking oportunity.
